intro: Pentopetia bosseri, commonly known as the Bosser's pentopetia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical conditions and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
